articles.title: VIDEO: These digital billboards are watching you right back
articles.description: Tonight on 'Closer Look': The federal Privacy Commissioner is investigating the use of anonymous video analytics (AVA), a controversial ad technology that tracks the age and gender of people walking by
articles.content:
Imagine looking at a billboard — then realizing it’s watching you back.
That’s exactly what’s happening near Union Station in Toronto, where certain signs are outfitted with small cameras that record every person walking by. Known as anonymous video ... [1755 chars]

articles.title: Is this a good year for tax-loss harvesting?
articles.description: Thanks to market swings, evolving tax laws and new technology, it may be a good year to consider tax-loss harvesting – a strategy that can help reduce taxes and improve long-term retur
articles.content:
Thanks to market swings, evolving tax laws and new technology, it may be a good year to consider tax-loss harvesting – a strategy that can help reduce taxes and improve long-term returns.

articles.title: Chinese AI Euphoria Obscures a Gloomier Technological Reality
articles.description: Moore Threads Technology Co.’s phenomenal debut this month — China’s most successful coming-out party since 2019 — capped a year in which investors have grown increasingly excited about the prospects for the country’s AI chip advancement. That euphoria may be misplaced.
articles.content: Moore Threads Technology Co.’s phenomenal debut this month — China’s most successful coming-out party since 2019 — capped a year in which investors have grown increasingly excited about the prospects for the country’s AI chip advancement. That euphor... [727 chars]

articles.title: Wall St ends lower on fears over AI bubble, inflation
articles.description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq closed down more than 1% on Friday with investors leaving technology for other sectors as Broadcom and Oracle fuelled concerns about an AI bubble and rising US Treasury yields added pressure after some policymakers spoke out against easing monetary policy.
articles.content: NEW YORK: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq closed down more than 1% on Friday with investors leaving technology for other sectors as Broadcom and Oracle fuelled concerns about an AI bubble and rising US Treasury yields added pressure after some policymaker... [253 chars]

articles.title: Global Markets Slump Amid AI Concerns and Interest Rate Jitters
articles.description: Major stock indexes fell on Friday as technology-related shares dropped amid AI investment concerns. Treasury yields jumped as Federal Reserve officials expressed inflation worries. Global economic data influenced currency movements, with the pound slipping and the dollar gaining. Commodity markets also faced volatility, with copper prices plunging significantly.
articles.content:
Major stock indexes faced a downturn on Friday, with substantial declines in technology shares as investors hesitated on AI-related moves. The tech sector saw a 2.9% drop, heavily impacting the S&P 500.
U.S. Treasury yields rose sharply, reflecting i... [391 chars]

articles.title: Follow America First strategy, visiting USTR officials told US tech companies
articles.description: The US trade team, led by USTR officials, emphasized on American companies investing in technology and AI in the American market during their two-day visit to India. They also urged for the creation of local jobs instead of outsourcing. The US plans to utilize recent investments in AI data centers in India.

Business 34 min ago
